intro: Erythraea emarginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf erythraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with a pointed tip. Its showy, pinkish-white flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
